page.title: 09THE VILLAGE OF OTTRINGHAM
page.content: Ottringham has actually decreased in population and is only slowly increasing now, with the development of nearly all the residential buildingland available. The original Ottringham has remained little changed for years with its village hall, institute and games room. St. Wilfreds church of England towers above the main street, once a large congragation sadly depleated as is the Methodist church. Having two public houses, one having a restaurant, two shops and a Post Office, we have some visitors but generally it is a village that prefers to remain undeveloped and quiet. It has provided well for itself having a playing field and equipment, several clubs and organisations for old and young and a great sense of community spirit.
